item.title: Galkon's Refactored Skill Cape Gfx Model Help
item.dc:creator: @moparscapesk moparscapesk
item.description:
@moparscapesk wrote:

zecere:

wats wrong with it… its the gfx… u need the anim too… theres nothing wrong with it

I added animations too and still look what is it doing :
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=25rmtbhhtG4
Here is my client.java server side

public void capeEmote() { if (playerEquipment[playerCape]==7986) { //range CreatePlayerGfx(641, 100, 0); startAnimation(866, 0); } }
Here is my animation.java client side

if(j == 866){//range int file = 1290; if(FrameStart[file] < 1) Class36.methodCustomAnimations(false, file); int[] frames = {1361,1372,1383,1394,1405,1416,1420,1421,1422,1362,1363,1364,1365,1366,1367,1368,1369,1370,1371,1373,1374,1375,1376,1377,1378,1379,1380,1381,1382,1384,1385,1386,1387,1388,1389,1390,1391,1392,1393,1395,1396,1397,1398,1399,1400,1401,1402,1403,1404,1406,1407,1408,1409,1410,1411,1412,1413,1414,1415,1417,1418,1419,0}; int[] delays = {4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,4,0}; anims[j].anInt352 = frames.length-1; anims[j].anIntArray353 = new int[frames.length-1]; anims[j].anIntArray354 = new int[frames.length-1]; anims[j].anIntArray355 = new int[frames.length-1]; for(int i2 = 0; i2 < frames.length-1; i2++){ anims[j].anIntArray353[i2] = frames[i2]+FrameStart[file]; anims[j].anIntArray354[i2] = -1; anims[j].anIntArray355[i2] = delays[i2]; } }
Here is my spotanim.java client side

case 641: // cape (GFX) cache[j].anInt405 = 19087; //Model Id cache[j].anInt406 = 866; //Model Movement cache[j].aAnimation_407 = Animation.anims[cache[j].anInt406]; break;
Every gfx models are doing the same thing

Read full topic

item.title: Galkon's Refactored Skill Cape Gfx Model Help
item.dc:creator: @moparscapesk moparscapesk
item.description:
@moparscapesk wrote:

I downloaded models to skillcapes and when I added them it looks like this :

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IZTs7yjvB0c

This is code I used for coding emotes :

case 641: // cape (GFX)
cache[j].anInt405 = 19087; //Model Id
cache[j].anInt406 = 850; //Model Movement
cache[j].aAnimation_407 = Animation.anims[cache[j].anInt406];
break;

case 642: // cape (GFX)
cache[j].anInt405 = 30033; //Model Id
cache[j].anInt406 = 867; //Model Movement
cache[j].aAnimation_407 = Animation.anims[cache[j].anInt406];
break;

If someone can help me out it will be great

Read full topic
